div.p: A DeviceAlert represents an exceptional condition or occurrence determined to exist by a device.
The term "alert" covers both alarms and non-alarm informational data.
Alerts may be physiological (about the state of a patient) or technical (about the state of the device, for example indicating that a particular observation cannot be made due to a malfunction)
An alert often requires notification and possibly urgent or timely action by a clinician or biomedical technician
It has a severity attribute which may be notification-only, a concerning medium-priority condition requiring awareness, or a possibly life-threatening requiring immediate action

The state described in a DeviceAlert instance requires electronic handling different from the usual periodic (repetitive, scheduled) observations that may be sent by a device to an electronic medical record system for charting. Since these are scheduled according to charting preferences, there is a need for a different message type that is sent as fast as technically feasible, by a specialized, low-latency subsystem of the device.
The purpose of the DeviceAlert resource is:

ul.li: to bring the occurrence and lifecycle of an alert condition and associated signals into the FHIR ecosystem, available to other systems and functions.
The track the existence of one or more kinds of signals emitted by a device as a result of the condition, such as audible, visual, or haptic

div.p: This requires tracking of the condition's state, time of its persistence if it is no longer active, state of local and remote signals relating to the condition and whether they have been responded to.

It should be noted that the handling and use of such information is subject to safety, regulatory, manufacturing, testing and technical standards. Any integrators of a system making use of device alerts and signals is responsible for rigorous risk analysis and testing to assure safety, efficacy, and security of the intended use of the system in its system environment.
Examples of alert conditions represented by a DeviceAlert:

ul.li: physiological measurement that is high or low relative to a threshold preselected as significant for the patient
malfunction of life-supporting or therapy-supporting equipment, such as occluded infusion line
technical condition interfering with monitoring function such as a detached or loose ECG leads

div.p: These are the DeviceAlert related resources:

ul.li: Device: The physical, virtual, or software device that this DeviceAlert is for. Note that the Device.property element is used to record static characteristics or properties of the Device. A DeviceAlert is originated by a device represented by a Device resource, which may be a component of another Device: a specific subsystem, channel, or metric. An additional alert signal may be emitted by a device, system, or equipment (such as an annunciator) other than the device that determined the signal.

DeviceDefinition: Describes a "kind" of device - not a specific instance of the device. Note alternatively to Device the DeviceDefinition.property element may be used to record static characteristics or properties of the DeviceDefinition.
Observation: Used to record the particular value underlying or supporting the DeviceAlert at a point in time.
DeviceMetric: In some cases, a DeviceAlert is supported by information about a particular metric subsystem in a DeviceMetric resource, such as the configured alarm limits set for a measurement.
